717987f-c.text:
i1)
Canal Street, at, adjoining and west of the N.4. corner of Forsyth Street. This view does not include the ground floor of the building;. The Manhattan Bridge Plaza is shown in the
foreground.
July 23, 1930.
P. L. Sperr.
No Refroductions.
(2)
The same, a closer view.
July 23, 1930.
P. L. Sperr.
(3)
The same, showing more of the buildings demolished.
Augst 31, 1930.
P. L. Sperr.

719758f-c.text:
(1)
29 to 24 Forsyth Street, adjoining and south of the S.E. corner of Canal Street. Shown at No. 27 is the Greek Orthodox Church of St.
John the Baptist.
June 6, 1930.
P. L. Sperr.
(2)
The same, showing a slightly limited view.
June 6, 1930.
P. L. Sperr.
(3)
Showing the church proper with the adjoining building (No. 26)
already demolished.
October 12, 1930.
P. L. Sperr.

719762f-b.text:
(1)
Forsyth Street, west side, north from Canal Street, showing elearance between Forsyth and Chrystie Streets, north of the Manhattan Bridge Plasa. Buildings on the left, are on the west side of Chrystie
Street. Note Libby's Hotel still standing.
October 11, 1930.
P. L. Sperr.
(2)
The sasas, at a later date, and showing the Sarah Delano Roosevelt
Park under construction.
May 6, 1934.
P. L. Sperr.
(3)
The same as No. 2, from a different angle.
July 11, 1934.
P. L. SPerr.
719762f-b.folder: Forsyth Street & Canal Street, Manhattan, NY

719761f-b.text:
(1)  Forsyth Street, east side, north from, but not including Canal Street. Clearance shown between Forsyth and Chrystie Streets, is being
prepared for new park.
October 20, 1934.
P. L. Sperr.
(2)
The same, showing the completed Sarah Delano Roosevelt Park. P.S. No. 65, is shown at Nos. 42 to 52, between Canal and Hester Streets.
May 14, 1936.
P. L. Sperr.
(3) The same, showing a closer view of park interior.
April 30, 1936.
P. L. Sperr.
719761f-b.folder: Forsyth Street & Canal Street, Manhattan, NY
